revised_title: Investigation of the Silver-Magnesium-Antimony System and its Implications for Alloy Formation
tldr: The authors studied the silver-magnesium-antimony system to understand the factors affecting the formation of ternary alloys. They found that the compound formed by the solute elements has a significant impact on the equilibrium relationships in the system. The study provides insights into the behavior of alloys and their potential applications in metallurgy and material science.
